name: Lilium tigrinum
Relationship: Compare: CACT.; HELON.; MUREX; SEP.; PLAT.; PALLAD.Antidote: HELON.

Heart: Pain in cardiac region with feeling of a load on chest
Suffocating feeling in a crowded and warm room
Angina pectoris with pain in right arm
Sensation as if heart were grasped in a vise
Eyes: Pain, extending back into head; lachrymation; and impaired vision
Useful in restoring power to the weakened ciliary muscle
Fever: Great heat and lassitude in afternoon, with throbbing throughout body
Stomach: Thirsty, drinks often and much, and before severe symptoms
Flatulent; nausea, with sensation of lump in stomach
Head: Faint in warm room
Hot, dull, heavy
Wild feeling in head
Mind: Anxious; fears some organic and incurable disease
Aimless, hurried manner; must keep busy
Disposed to curse, strike, think obscene things
Stool: Dysentery; mucus and blood, with tenesmus, especially in plethoric and nervous women at change of life
Constant desire to defecate; from pressure in rectum, worse standing
Abdomen: Pressure downwards and backwards against rectum and anus; worse, standing; better, walking in open air
Bearing down in lower part of abdomen
Abdomen sore, distended; trembling sensation in abdomen
Female: Constant desire to support parts externally
Menses early, scanty, dark, clotted, offensive; flow only when moving about
Congestion of uterus, prolapse, and anteversion
Pain in ovaries and down thighs
Bearing-down sensation with urgent desire for stool, as though all organs would escape
Acrid, brown leucorrhoea; smarting in labia
Sleep: Unable to sleep, with wild feeling in head
Extremities: Legs ache; cannot keep them still
Pain in right arm and hip
Pain in back and spine, with trembling, but oftener in front of a pressing-down character

details: Manifests powerful influence over the pelvic organs, and is adapted to many reflex states dependent on some pathological condition of uterus and ovaries. More often indicated in unmarried women. The action on the heart is very marked. Pain in small spots. (OXAL-AC.) Rheumatic arthritis.
dosage: The middle and higher potencies seem to have done best. Its curative action sometimes is slow in developing itself.
